title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Pennington, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It starts off with a presentation regarding the residency program. It is then followed by a panel-style interview with five tables and about 15 minutes for each table for several departments. A bit intimidating and you're with other candidates.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with conflict. What animal would you be and why? Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: For new grad residency in group interview. Multiple nurse mangers from different floors had five mins to ask questions in small groups. Bring printed out copies of resume. Can be automatic hire for ED or hired for residency and will later be placed.
Interview Questions: How to deal with stressful situations

title: IT Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: First Call with the Talent Acquisition Manager was great. Very clear and informative with scheduling an interview time with the hiring manager. The 30 minutes with the hiring manager was spent explaining the Capital Health system as opposed to learning more about me as a candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current role?

title: Eligibility Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process, called me for an in person interview, spoke to hiring manager, it lasted about 15 min, took a quick tour and then got a call back a few weeks later
Interview Questions: My past experience that would contribute to the position itself

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Hopewell, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview and you were timed on your answers.  You really had a fair opportunity to speak though. It also demonstrated how well you get along and can work with others.
Interview Questions:
Name a time when you were in a difficult situation. 

Name the superhero that you can identify most with.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward- talked to me like I basically got the job and gave me information on training and what type of floor I would be working on. Training also wasn’t difficult.
Interview Questions: N/A - like I mentioned was just telling me what to expect with the job , and what my job would entail

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It's faster for internal candidates; I applied and accepted the job within a month.
As an external candidate, it took probably 3 months for call back. They will email/call you for interview then at the interview you will meet the manager then it's the waiting time
Interview Questions: What's your short-term and long-term goal?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: I had an in person panel interview with a few of the managers/supervisors for about 30 mins, followed by a tour of the lab. Overall it was a quick process, and no phone interviews prior.
Interview Questions: How do I handle stressful situations

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse manager and both day and night charge nurse. Easy interview process. They have a recruiter who contacts you also before and after. Very nice administrative staff.
Interview Questions: They asked a patient care question

title: ER Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with a nurse manager and the scheduler for the emergency department at Capital Health Regional Medical Center. They asked me a series of questions to ensure that I was a good fit the the ED. They gave me a tour of the ED and the trauma bay. One of the nurses walked me out to where I parked.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my experience, coursework to support my experience, and my previous occupations. I was made to feel comfortable and was told several times that in this role I should be kind to myself as I get adjusted to the trauma factor.
Interview Questions: How can we help you to succeed here?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Hopewell, NJ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was haphazard and thrown together at the last minute. It showed. The process was not transparent. I interviewed for the residency program and was told that I could select any three of my preferred units to be placed on. However, once I got to orientation I learned that I basically only had three units to choose from. On the other hand, some people who had interviewed were immediately placed on units, some of which they liked, others they hated. It seems unprofessional to mislead candidates that way. It is clear that they created the residency program to staff units that nobody wants to work on.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Capital Health System in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: New grad residency has an interview process that is similar to speed dating. There are educators and managers at each station (10ish total) and you rotate with fellow applications and the interviewer asks questions regarding experience, goals and scenario
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? If I were to look at your social media right now what would I find? What was your favorite experience in nursing school?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was Efficient and  organized.  The Recruiter/HR kept candidate informed every step of the way.  Their communication was timely.  Everyone I met was pleasant, cordial and professional. Interview questions were relevant and appropriate.
Interview Questions: How wIll you contribute to the team if hired ?

title: Clinical Information Manager (CIM) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Parsippany, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward questions. No out of the box type of questions. They will have you type sentences from a visual and then verbal prompt on a computer to determine your speed.
Interview Questions: A time when you took leadership

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website and received an email 2 days later for an interview  for the following week. I met with the Chief Physician Assistant and the head physician.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job online. Received phone call from recruiter 3/4 weeks later and interviewed 2 days later.  I interviewed with first with HR and then with the floor nurse manager and assistant manager.  I was given a tour of the unit after the interview and I received an offer about a month after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in 3 words.

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was expected to re-interview for same position, Human Resources did not handle the position posting properly. Position was cancelled and Director nor Human Resources contacted me. Recieved an auto reply email. Very informal and cold.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult employee?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions:
very disorganized. misleading, not specifying role at the position.
Would have helped if the employment specifications were clear.
PA abuse. disrespected at work.
Employee exploitation.
Did not like working there.
very stressful work environment.
In hospital politics. back stabbing employees and management.
work experience makes one sick. unhealthy work environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Hopewell, NJ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process with manager. I met with the recruiter and she gave me information on pay and benefits. I was able to tour the floor. The interview was average.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and fast just took a day good place to work friendly environment typical day is to take patients back EKG's vitals history meds surgical laid back asked typical questions about my previous point of care testing and abilities with EMR you don't draw blood so that is a plus
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? Basic questions

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got the information about the open interview from Galssdoor. I sent the RSVP them went to the open house. There weren't not many applicants and it was quiet. The lady at the front desk called the nurse managers and I had an interview at the spot
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging time when you were working?

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Capital Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was easy, the interviews went fine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Trenton, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, about 7 days later, Got an email from a recruiter for Capital Health asking to schedule an interview.  Interview was 3 days later, and also met with the Nurse Manager.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Interviewing.  What If Situations.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Pennington, NJ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got an email from a recruiter for an in person interview. Had interview with manager and received a call back in 2 weeks. Background check drug test. They called my previous job
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Capital Health System (Jersey City, NJ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very professional easy to follow requirements before hire. Face to face meeting with hiring manager at site which I would be working, staff was kind, friendly and helpful.Drug testing, fingerprints and any vaccinations needed were available right on site.
Interview Questions: How did I handle stressful situations?
